credit_line: Museum purchase, Joseph O. Eaton Fund
title: Book and Mirror
inscriptions: on cardboard back of mirror in brown or gold ink: Quotes from:// I. Sir James Fraser, The New Golden Bough[underlined]// II. Pansassious, Guide to Greece[underlined] (trans. Peter Levi,sq.)// III.ibid. (footnoted information by Peter Levi)// IV. Robert Graves, The Greek Myths[underlined] // V. ibid. // VI. ibid. (This should explain the letters on the ruler: each consonant represents a 28 day// month; the vowels represent from left to right// Winter Solstice, Vernal Equinox, Summer// Solstice, Autumnal Equinox, or Winter Solstice again. This kind of calendar/alphabet// prevailed until 400 B.C. December 23 is the beginning and end of this ancient // year. It is also my birthday.)// William Giersbach  1976.
